body.name: Operation: Snare Drum: A WWII Submarine Adventure Novel (USS Bull Shark Naval Thriller series Book 1)

productInformation.name: Best Sellers Rank
productInformation.value: #11,569 in Kindle Store (See Top 100 in Kindle Store) #53 in War Fiction (Kindle Store) #54 in War & Military Action Fiction (Kindle Store) #76 in Historical World War II Fiction

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great book I could hardly put it down
reviews.reviewText: I don't often review books, but liked this one well enough to comment.I like action books and historical settings that allow you to get invested in the characters of the book. This book delivers on all fronts. I felt like I was there with the crew. I am anxious to start the next in the series.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Top Notch Submariner Tale
reviews.reviewText: I spent 24 years in surface Navy, specializing in ASW. I spent a couple weeks in nuclear fast attack for familiarization got to witness operations. These guys are a tough group. And in this old diesel boat, far tougher. Story was top notch and believable. I thought Joan driving the boat was a stretch, but fun nonetheless less. Targeting a charging DD with a deck load of depth charges has got to be the place for a cool hand. Very Good Thank you, hoping to see Bull Shark in my Pacific!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Thrilling Submarine Read
reviews.reviewText: This is a real page turner. It keeps you on the edge of your seat from the beginning through the end.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars not great historical fiction
reviews.reviewText: The story is a little fantastical but ultimately readable. The problem I had is that much of the jargon and interesting bits about subs and how they operate goes unexplained. As a work of historical fiction this book fails in its mission to instruct and teach.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Interesting history with excellent characters. WW II war on American coast not usually featured in historical novels. Enjoyed meeting crew and their experiences

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2024
reviews.reviewText: An earlier submarine era than Clancy novels but his fans will enjoy this book. WW2 enthusiasts will also be intrigued. The character development is particularly rich.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewText: A thoroughly enjoyable novel if you like WWII historical fictional stories I would highly recommend this well written story .

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars A real thriller.
reviews.reviewText: Most military novels that claim to be thrillers are less than satisfying. This one was very satisfying and left me anxious to read the next in the series.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 27, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I love this type of story and read a few. This one from the American perspective was great. Question what happened to the British destroyer?

reviews.reviewTitle: lots of action under the waves……
reviews.reviewText: A story told by a master weaver of action. The character development grew with each page and the integration of other characters was perfectly woven into the fabric of the story. A book that defied being put down easily. Time flew and it was past 4 a.m. and I had to get some sleep before 8 a.m. Well, putting the book down didn’t work out and so I had a long and tiring day. But it was well worth it !!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 11, 2023
reviews.reviewText: There are many contemporary submarine stories, and we are used to the mechanics of thechase and kill. The non-digital 1942 warfare is more interesting.Of course we have the stories of the personal relations of some of our heroes in a slightly cloying manner. The personalities of the sailors are sufficiently interesting.

reviews.reviewTitle: I enjoy war stories and especially navel adventures but ...
reviews.reviewText: This book was slow going for more than half of it but picked up pace later. Unfortunately that pace increase was due to the SS landing on American shores and kidnapping the wife of the only US military unit that was trying to stop the Germans on the US eastern seaboard. A sub commander. Fortunately the Germans just happened to have a Nazi spy that was close to the sub commander's wife. Couple this with 2 German soldiers that were more than happy to betray their company after only a few hours in American hands. Just an every day event it seems. This is beyond ludicrous and into comic book land. I deleted the book unfinished.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on October 17, 2023
reviews.reviewText: A Submarine action-packed dramaLots of technical stuff ,so much that I felt after reading it that I could help sail a submarineLearnt a lot. Absorbed some moreGreat read
